net.cloud.gfx.sprites

Class SpriteLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.sprites.SpriteLoader

  • public class SpriteLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    A call which contains the code to handle loading sprites. Moreover exists to separate the complexity of doing this from the SpriteManager class.

    • Method Detail

      • loadEntireSet

        public void loadEntireSet(SpriteSet set,
                          SpriteCollection collection)
                   throws FileRequestException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Load an entire set of sprites and place them in the collection. Note that this method is intended to be used as a startup operation, and will not synchronize its modifications of the collection for efficiency reasons.
        Parameters:
        set - The SpriteSet to load all of the sprites for
        collection - The SpriteCollection to place all of the sprites into
        Throws:
        FileRequestException - If the set's data could not be retrieved
        java.io.IOException - If a sprite file could not be read into an image

      • loadSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage loadSprite(SpriteSet set,
                                               SpriteCollection collection,
                                               int spriteID)
                                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                               FileRequestException,
                                               java.io.IOException
        Load an image that has not already been loaded. This method will load a sprite and place it into its collection. It will then return the image. In order to load the image, the collection will need to be locked - so this method may block until the needed lock(s) are acquired. For some collections, it will also spur off background loading of a block of images. Even if this happens, the requested image will be loaded and return as soon as possible.
        Parameters:
        set - The sprite set the needed image is in
        collection - The collection of images to place the sprite into
        spriteID - The ID of the sprite to be loaded
        Returns:
        The image of the sprite once it has been loaded
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread was interrupted before loading could happen
        FileRequestException - If the FileServer could not get the image files
        java.io.IOException - If the sprite file data could not be read

      • finishLoading

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage finishLoading(SpriteSet set,
                                                  SimpleSpriteCollection collection,
                                                  int spriteID,
                                                  CachedFileRequest pendingRequest)
                                           throws FileRequestException,
                                                  java.io.IOException
        Picks up where loadImage() left off. However, it finishes loading in a manner suitable for a simple sprite collection.
        This method exists for double dispatch reasons, rather than using a conditional statement.
        Parameters:
        set - The sprite set the needed image is in
        collection - The collection of images to place the sprite into
        spriteID - The ID of the sprite to be loaded
        pendingRequest - The file request grabbing the sprite's data
        Returns:
        The image of the sprite once it has been loaded
        Throws:
        FileRequestException - If the FileServer could not get the image files
        java.io.IOException - If the sprite file data could not be read

      • finishLoading

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage finishLoading(SpriteSet set,
                                                  BlockSpriteCollection collection,
                                                  int spriteID,
                                                  CachedFileRequest pendingRequest)
                                           throws FileRequestException,
                                                  java.io.IOException
        Picks up where loadImage() left off. However, it finishes loading in a manner suitable for a block sprite collection. This is unique in that it will prioritize loading and returning the requested image, but then will start background loading a block of other sprites. The lock on the collection will not be released until the block loading is done.
        This method exists for double dispatch reasons, rather than using a conditional statement.
        Parameters:
        set - The sprite set the needed image is in
        collection - The collection of images to place the sprite into
        spriteID - The ID of the sprite to be loaded
        pendingRequest - The file request grabbing the sprite's data
        Returns:
        The image of the sprite once it has been loaded
        Throws:
        FileRequestException - If the FileServer could not get the image files
        java.io.IOException - If the sprite file data could not be read
